revised_title: Microseismic Waves: Estimation of Direction of Approach Using Vertical and Horizontal Components
tldr: The authors analyzed microseismic waves recorded at Kew Observatory to study their structure and direction of approach. They found that microseisms consist of Rayleigh and Love waves in comparable proportions. By comparing the vertical and horizontal components of the waves, they estimated the direction of the microseism-generating area, providing further confirmation of the wave-interference theory of microseism generation.
